result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone Patrick

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrone Patrick in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Tyrone Patrick.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held OFF THE RECORD. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tyrone Patrick in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requested more time to review new information.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyrone Patrick in court, appear by video with attorney Amanda Poznanski, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrone Patrick in court with attorney Colin McGinn appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attoreny McGinn covering for attorney Pozanski in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for Level 3 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test and portable breathalyzers. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Tyrone Patrick in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 5/5/22 @ 1:30p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/5/22 @ 1:30p
